note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 1 treating right lower lobe.
Patient: Amelia Green, 44-year-old female with severe persistent asthma on maximal inhaler therapy and frequent exacerbations.
Sedation: Moderate sedation with midazolam and fentanyl; native airway with supplemental oxygen by nasal cannula.
Procedure details: Flexible bronchoscope advanced through the oropharynx to inspect the tracheobronchial tree. Bronchial thermoplasty catheter deployed to segmental and subsegmental branches of the right lower lobe. Approximately 52 radiofrequency activations were delivered with good contact and visible airway wall blanching. Secretions were suctioned; no biopsies or lavage were performed.
Complications: Mild transient wheezing and cough during activations without desaturation or hemodynamic instability.
Disposition: Observed in the bronchoscopy recovery area for 4 hours, then discharged home on a prednisone burst and continuation of high-dose ICS/LABA and LAMA.

registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Return in 3 weeks for bronchial thermoplasty session 2 (left lower lobe).

bullets: Procedure description documents bronchial thermoplasty confined to the right lower lobe with multiple catheter activations.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 1 treating right lower lobe.
Patient: Noah King, 50-year-old male with severe persistent asthma uncontrolled despite high-dose ICS/LABA, LAMA, and biologic therapy.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with endotracheal intubation.
Procedure details: After induction of general anesthesia, a flexible bronchoscope was passed through the endotracheal tube. The bronchial thermoplasty catheter was sequentially positioned in segmental and subsegmental right lower lobe bronchi. Forty-nine activations were delivered respecting manufacturer-specified temperature and cycle duration. Airways were inspected post-treatment and noted to be patent without endobronchial lesions.
Complications: No significant intra-procedural bronchospasm, bleeding, or hypoxemia.
Disposition: Extubated in the procedure room, monitored for 4 hours, and discharged home with a steroid taper and unchanged controller regimen.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 2 treating left lower lobe.
Patient: Amelia Green, 44-year-old female with severe persistent asthma status post successful right lower lobe thermoplasty 3 weeks prior.
Sedation: Monitored anesthesia care with propofol infusion; native airway with nasal cannula oxygen.
Procedure details: Flexible bronchoscope advanced to the left lower lobe. The thermoplasty catheter was advanced into segmental and subsegmental branches, and 48 activations were delivered evenly throughout the left lower lobe. No lavage, biopsy, or additional interventions were performed.
Complications: No significant bronchospasm, bleeding, or hypoxemia.
Disposition: Recovered uneventfully in the bronchoscopy suite and discharged home after 4 hours of observation with continuation of controller therapy.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 2 treating left lower lobe.
Patient: Noah King, 50-year-old male with severe persistent asthma following prior right lower lobe thermoplasty.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with endotracheal tube.
Procedure details: Under general anesthesia, flexible bronchoscopy was performed via the endotracheal tube. The bronchial thermoplasty catheter was positioned in the left lower lobe segmental and subsegmental bronchi. Fifty activations were delivered with adequate contact and no visual evidence of airway injury. No lavage or biopsies were obtained.
Complications: None beyond expected post-procedure cough.
Disposition: Extubated in the procedure suite and discharged home the same day after routine monitoring.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 3 treating bilateral upper lobes.
Patient: Amelia Green, 44-year-old female with severe persistent asthma status post right and left lower lobe thermoplasty sessions.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with laryngeal mask airway.
Procedure details: Flexible bronchoscopy performed through a laryngeal mask airway. The thermoplasty catheter was advanced sequentially to the right and left upper lobe segmental and subsegmental bronchi. A total of 60 activations were delivered (approximately 30 per upper lobe) with stable airway pressures and no visible airway trauma. No diagnostic sampling was performed.
Complications: Mild post-procedure cough only; no bronchospasm or desaturation.
Disposition: Recovered in the post-anesthesia care unit and admitted overnight to the pulmonary floor for routine post-thermoplasty observation.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 3 treating bilateral upper lobes.
Patient: Noah King, 50-year-old male with severe persistent asthma after completion of lower lobe thermoplasty sessions.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with endotracheal intubation.
Procedure details: Under general anesthesia, flexible bronchoscopy was performed via endotracheal tube. The bronchial thermoplasty catheter was sequentially deployed in the right and left upper lobe segmental bronchi. Fifty-eight activations were delivered with good catheter contact and appropriate cycle times. Airways were re-inspected and remained hemostatic and patent.
Complications: No immediate bronchospasm or significant hypoxemia.
Disposition: Admitted overnight to the step-down unit for observation and systemic steroid taper.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 2 treating left lower lobe.
Patient: Sofia Martinez, 39-year-old female with severe persistent asthma and recent prednisone-dependent exacerbations.
Sedation: Moderate sedation with midazolam and fentanyl; native airway with high-flow nasal cannula.
Procedure details: Flexible bronchoscopy performed via the oropharynx. The thermoplasty catheter was advanced to segmental and subsegmental left lower lobe bronchi. Forty-five activations were delivered; the procedure was briefly paused because of increased airway resistance and wheeze.
Complications: Moderate intra-procedural bronchospasm with transient desaturation to 88% managed with inhaled albuterol, IV magnesium, and IV methylprednisolone. No intubation was required and saturations returned to baseline.
Disposition: Observed overnight on the pulmonary floor with scheduled bronchodilators and systemic steroids.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Severe persistent asthma with frequent exacerbations despite maximal therapy.
registry_entry.pre_op_status: Steroid-dependent asthma with multiple exacerbations in the prior year.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Bronchial thermoplasty session 2 for severe asthma
registry_entry.bronch_immediate_complications: Moderate bronchospasm with transient hypoxemia managed medically; no intubation.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Severe asthma treated with bronchial thermoplasty session 2 complicated by bronchospasm.
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Pulmonary follow-up in 4 to 6 weeks to assess recovery and determine timing of completion thermoplasty.

lines.selection_reason: Single-lobe bronchial thermoplasty of the left lower lobe complicated by intra-procedural bronchospasm.
note_spans: Forty-five activations were delivered; the procedure was briefly paused because of increased airway resistance and wheeze.

per_code.notes: Standard 2025 facility values for 31660 are applied despite the presence of bronchospasm, which does not change the CPT selection.

financial_analysis.notes: No additional codes are modeled for bronchospasm management; care is considered inherent to the bronchial thermoplasty service.

bullets: Bronchial thermoplasty is limited to a single lobe (left lower lobe) in this encounter, consistent with 31660.
Management of intra-procedural bronchospasm (bronchodilators, IV steroids, magnesium) is considered part of the global service and does not support separate CPT codes.

note_text:
Interventional Pulmonology Procedure Note
Procedure: Bronchial thermoplasty session 3 treating bilateral upper lobes (aborted early).
Patient: Liam Patel, 56-year-old male with severe steroid-dependent asthma and frequent ICU admissions.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with endotracheal intubation.
Procedure details: After induction of anesthesia, flexible bronchoscopy was performed via endotracheal tube. Bronchial thermoplasty catheter was positioned in the right and left upper lobe segmental bronchi. Thirty-four activations were delivered before abrupt increase in airway pressures and severe wheeze prompted early termination of the procedure.
Complications: Severe bronchospasm with acute hypoxemic respiratory failure requiring deepening of anesthesia, continuous nebulized bronchodilators, IV epinephrine, and continued mechanical ventilation in the ICU. No significant bleeding or pneumothorax.
Disposition: Procedure aborted; patient transported intubated to the ICU for ongoing ventilatory and bronchodilator management.

Patient: Liam Patel, 56-year-old male with severe steroid-dependent asthma and frequent ICU admissions.

Bronchial thermoplasty catheter was positioned in the right and left upper lobe segmental bronchi. Thirty-four activations were delivered before abrupt increase in airway pressures and severe wheeze prompted early termination of the procedure.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Severe steroid-dependent asthma with prior ICU admissions for status asthmaticus.
registry_entry.pre_op_status: High-risk asthma with recent hospitalization requiring systemic steroids and noninvasive ventilation.
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Bronchial thermoplasty final session for severe asthma
registry_entry.bronch_immediate_complications: Severe bronchospasm with acute respiratory failure requiring ongoing mechanical ventilation and ICU admission; thermoplasty stopped early.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Severe asthma with bronchial thermoplasty session 3 aborted due to severe bronchospasm and respiratory failure.
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Completion thermoplasty deferred; follow-up in asthma clinic after recovery from ICU stay.

lines.selection_reason: Bronchial thermoplasty targeting both upper lobes aborted early because of severe bronchospasm; single 31660 still captures the attempted thermoplasty.
note_spans: Thirty-four activations were delivered before abrupt increase in airway pressures and severe wheeze prompted early termination of the procedure.

per_code.notes: Full 31660 RVUs and payment are modeled, as the procedure was initiated and complex bronchospasm management occurred during the same session.

financial_analysis.notes: No separate critical care or bronchoscopy codes are modeled; ICU management is considered outside the registry episode-level calculation.

bullets: Thermoplasty was initiated in both upper lobes with multiple activations prior to early termination, which supports reporting 31660 for the attempted service.
Severe bronchospasm and ICU admission represent complications of the procedure and ongoing critical care, not distinct bronchoscopic CPT services for coding purposes in this registry context.
